title: LATAM crypto news: Crypto.com gains Argentina approval, Helium expands in Mexico
body: LATAM‚Äôs cryptocurrency landscape continues to grow. This week‚Äôs highlights come from Argentina, which recently granted Crypto.com operating approval. Meanwhile, Hellium installed 100 mobile hotspots in Mexico. The National Securities Commission (CNV) of Argentina has approved Crypto.com to operate as a Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP), according to their official website. This achievement is a crucial milestone for the organization, as they continue to pursue a complete operating license under the new restrictions published on March 14. Alain Yacine, president of Crypto.com for Latin America, expressed delight in the achievement and enthusiasm for giving Argentine customers and merchants a safer and more comprehensive crypto trading experience. The Latin American market, notably Argentina, is quickly increasing bitcoin usage, making it a key emphasis of Crypto.com‚Äôs growth plan. According to recent research, nearly half (46%) of Argentine respondents believe it is vital to spend cryptocurrency via a debit card, with more than half (57%) planning to invest in cryptocurrencies within the next year. Argentina has more than 10 million crypto asset accounts, indicating a strong interest in financial technology and digital currency. According to Crypto.com, local stablecoin activity makes up 61.8% of transaction volume, much exceeding the global average of 44.7%. This demonstrates a desire for financial security in an unpredictable economic climate. The expanding legal frameworks are critical for user safety, as they seek to promote transparency and protection inside Argentina‚Äôs crypto ecosystem, paving the road for a more regulated market. Helium installs 100 mobile hotspots across 18 cities in Mexico Helium is growing its network in Mexico, with the recent installation of 100 new mobile hotspots, bringing the total number to 736 across the nation. According to Cointelegraph , this big breakthrough comes after the company‚Äôs collaboration announcement with Movistar in February. Helium, noted for its decentralized wireless communication platform built on the Solana blockchain, aims to improve user connectivity and service quality while encouraging community-driven network growth. Helium has recorded a total of 281.83 GB of data moved over the last 30 days, showing strong activity in the region. Daily data transmission amounts vary greatly, with peaks surpassing 40 GB on some days and low activity on others. This variance implies that the network has a dynamic usage pattern, which is maintained by community members who contribute to its expansion by adding new hotspots and earning HNT awards for their efforts. Bitso: 39% of the crypto community in LATAM preferred stablecoins in 2024 According to Bitso‚Äôs most recent estimate, in 2024, 39% of Latin American users would turn to stablecoins as a haven in the face of economic crises such as inflation and currency depreciation. The ‚ÄúPanorama Cripto en Am√©rica Latina‚Äù report shows a considerable movement toward stablecoins such as USDC and USDT, indicating a growing demand for these assets as a hedge against economic volatility. According to Cointelegraph , this desire matches broader developments in the region‚Äôs cryptocurrency market, as more people seek out digital assets that offer stability. The research also indicates a shift in customer preferences, with Bitcoin‚Äôs percentage of sales falling from 38% in 2023 to 22% in 2024. This reduction can be ascribed to Bitcoin‚Äôs rising price and a popular investing technique among users known as ‚ÄúHODL,‚Äù in which investors keep their Bitcoin rather than sell. Other cryptocurrencies are also gaining traction, with altcoins such as Ethereum and Solana holding their positions and meme coins such as PEPE and DOGE seeing significant rises in popularity, demonstrating a wide range of interest in digital assets. Furthermore, the paper highlights major trends in key nations such as Argentina, Brazil, and Colombia. In Argentina, hyperinflation and capital constraints have increased stablecoin adoption by 11%, increasing the total to 1.6 million users. Brazil‚Äôs regulatory developments and DeFi growth have resulted in stablecoins accounting for 26% of purchases, with a customer base of 1.9 million. Finally, in Colombia, the collapse of the Colombian peso has reinforced stablecoins as the preferred option among users, suggesting a regional response to economic uncertainty. The post LATAM crypto news: Crypto.com gains Argentina approval, Helium expands in Mexico appeared first on Invezz

title: Crucial Step: IMF Incorporates Digital Assets Guidance into Global Statistical Standards
body: Exciting news for the crypto world! The International Monetary Fund (IMF), a major player in global finance, has just taken a significant leap into the digital age. For the first time, the IMF is officially incorporating guidance for digital assets into its globally recognized statistical standards. This is not just a minor update; it‚Äôs a monumental shift that could reshape how countries account for and regulate cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Let‚Äôs dive into what this groundbreaking decision means for the future of crypto. Why is the IMF‚Äôs move on Digital Assets Guidance a Big Deal? Think of the IMF as the rulebook maker for global finance. When they set standards, countries pay attention. By including digital assets in their Balance of Payments Manual (BPM7), the IMF is providing a clear framework for how nations should statistically classify and monitor these assets. This is crucial because: Clarity and Consistency: Previously, the lack of uniform standards created a Wild West scenario, with each country interpreting and regulating crypto differently. The IMF‚Äôs guidance brings much-needed clarity and encourages consistent reporting across nations. Legitimacy Boost for Crypto: The IMF‚Äôs recognition elevates digital assets from a fringe phenomenon to a legitimate asset class worthy of international statistical attention. This can boost investor confidence and mainstream adoption. Foundation for Regulation: Sound statistics are the bedrock of effective policy and regulation. With standardized data collection, governments can make more informed decisions about cryptocurrency regulation , taxation, and economic policies related to digital assets. Global Economic Stability: As digital assets become increasingly intertwined with the global economy, proper accounting becomes vital for assessing financial stability risks. The IMF‚Äôs guidance helps in understanding and mitigating these risks. Breaking Down the IMF‚Äôs Classification of Digital Assets The IMF‚Äôs BPM7 provides a detailed categorization of different types of digital assets . Let‚Äôs break down the key classifications and understand what they mean: Bitcoin (BTC): The Non-Produced Nonfinancial Asset According to the IMF, Bitcoin (BTC) is categorized as a ‚Äúnon-produced nonfinancial asset.‚Äù What does this jargon actually mean? Non-produced: This means Bitcoin is not produced in the same way goods or services are. It‚Äôs created through a decentralized process (mining) rather than traditional production methods. Nonfinancial asset: This distinguishes Bitcoin from financial instruments like stocks or bonds. It‚Äôs seen more as a store of value or commodity-like asset in this classification. This classification implies that when Bitcoin is bought or sold, it‚Äôs recorded in the capital account as an acquisition or disposal of a non-productive asset. Think of it like trading gold or art ‚Äì it‚Äôs an exchange of value, not a financial instrument in the traditional sense. Stablecoins and Other Tokens: A Tale of Two Classifications The IMF doesn‚Äôt treat all cryptocurrencies the same. Here‚Äôs how other tokens are classified: Tokens without Liabilities (like BTC): These are also classified as capital assets, similar to Bitcoin. This generally applies to cryptocurrencies that operate without a central issuer or liability structure. Stablecoins Backed by Liabilities: Stablecoins, especially those pegged to fiat currencies and backed by reserves, are treated as ‚Äúfinancial instruments.‚Äù This is because they represent a claim against the issuer (the liability). This classification is crucial for regulatory purposes, as it brings stablecoins under the umbrella of financial regulations. Tokens with Protocols (like ETH and SOL): The IMF suggests that tokens associated with protocols or platforms, such as Ethereum (ETH) and Solana (SOL), could be viewed as ‚Äúequity-like holdings‚Äù and classified in the financial account. This is a fascinating perspective, hinting at recognizing these tokens as representing a stake in a network or ecosystem, similar to equity in a company. Staking Rewards: Are They Dividends? The IMF also touched upon staking rewards, a key feature of many proof-of-stake cryptocurrencies. They noted that staking rewards gained from holding tokens like ETH or SOL might be akin to equity dividends. This is a significant observation because: Income Classification: If staking rewards are considered dividends, they should be recorded under current account income. This has implications for taxation and how these rewards are treated in national accounts. Size and Purpose Matter: The IMF rightly points out that the classification might depend on the size and purpose of the holding. Large institutional staking might be treated differently from individual retail staking. Challenges and Opportunities Ahead While the IMF‚Äôs guidance is a positive step, it‚Äôs not a magic wand. There are still challenges and opportunities on the horizon: Challenges: Implementation Complexity: Translating these statistical standards into practical reporting frameworks across diverse countries will be complex. Nations have varying levels of technical capacity and regulatory structures. Evolving Crypto Landscape: The crypto world is incredibly dynamic. New types of digital assets and financial instruments are constantly emerging. The IMF will need to continuously update its guidance to keep pace with innovation. Data Collection Hurdles: Gathering accurate and consistent data on decentralized and often cross-border digital assets will be a significant challenge for statistical agencies worldwide. Opportunities: Enhanced Transparency: The IMF‚Äôs framework can foster greater transparency in the digital assets space, making it easier to track flows of funds and understand the economic impact of crypto. Improved Cross-Border Coordination: With a common statistical language, international cooperation on cryptocurrency regulation and combating illicit activities can be significantly enhanced. Mainstream Integration: Clearer statistical standards pave the way for smoother integration of digital assets into the mainstream financial system, potentially unlocking new economic opportunities. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for You? So, how does this IMF guidance affect you, whether you‚Äôre a crypto investor, a business, or just curious about the space? For Crypto Investors: This news signals growing institutional acceptance of digital assets . It could lead to more regulated and mature markets in the long run. Keep an eye on how your country adopts and implements these standards, as it could affect taxation and reporting requirements. For Crypto Businesses: Prepare for increased scrutiny and reporting obligations. Understanding the IMF‚Äôs classifications and potential national implementations will be crucial for compliance and strategic planning. For Policymakers: The IMF‚Äôs BPM7 provides a valuable toolkit for developing effective cryptocurrency regulation . Leverage this guidance to create balanced frameworks that foster innovation while mitigating risks. The Road Ahead for Digital Assets and Global Standards The IMF incorporating digital assets guidance into its global statistical standards is a truly pivotal moment. It marks a significant step towards bringing clarity, legitimacy, and structure to the rapidly evolving world of cryptocurrencies. While challenges remain, the opportunities for enhanced transparency, better regulation, and mainstream integration are immense. As the world increasingly embraces digital finance, the IMF‚Äôs framework will serve as a crucial foundation for navigating this exciting new frontier. To learn more about the latest explore our article on key developments shaping cryptocurrency regulation and market trends.

title: Analyst Compares Current Bitcoin Pullback to 2024 Market‚ÄîHere‚Äôs What They Found
body: Bitcoin continues to experience short-term volatility, struggling to maintain momentum above key resistance levels. After recently attempting to break back above the psychological $90,000 level, the asset has pulled back again. As of the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at approximately $83,239, down 2.2% over the past 24 hours and nearly 23% below its all-time high above $109,000 reached in January. Despite this, some analysts suggest underlying indicators may point toward a potential market rebound if specific conditions align. Related Reading: Bitcoin Whales Are Back‚ÄîCould This Be the Catalyst for the Next Rally? Stablecoin Trends Offer Insight into Bitcoin Market Liquidity Crypto Dan, a contributor to the CryptoQuant QuickTake platform shared an analysis titled ‚ÄúComparison of the March 2024 Correction and the Current Market,‚Äù focusing on the relationship between stablecoin supply and Bitcoin‚Äôs price behavior. According to Dan, the flow of stablecoins into the market can serve as a proxy for measuring potential buying power, with higher stablecoin reserves typically associated with increased purchasing capacity among market participants. Dan noted that during the March‚ÄìOctober 2024 correction phase, the supply of stablecoins remained relatively low or declined, contributing to a more prolonged bearish trend. In contrast, the current correction has been accompanied by a gradual increase in stablecoin supply, which may indicate that market participants are preparing to re-enter positions as they await favorable conditions. Dan wrote: The current market is in a state where it is ready to rise quickly whenever strong catalysts emerge. Patience remains essential in the investment market. While it is premature to declare the end of the bullish cycle, the market continues to present conditions worth monitoring closely. Notably, this upward trend in stablecoin reserves suggests that investors are not fully exiting the market but are instead adopting a wait-and-see approach, holding liquidity in stablecoins while watching for confirmation of a trend reversal. This behavior often precedes renewed buying activity when confidence begins to return. Sentiment Signals Shift on Binance as Ratio Turns Positive Another CryptoQuant analyst, Burak Kesmeci, analyzed the Taker Buy Sell Ratio on Binance‚Äîan exchange widely viewed as a leading barometer of retail and institutional sentiment due to its high trading volume. The Taker Buy Sell Ratio measures the aggressiveness of buyers versus sellers, with values above 1.00 indicating that buyers are initiating more trades than sellers. Kesmeci observed that this ratio has been steadily forming higher lows over the past ten days and recently transitioned from the negative to the positive zone. Related Reading: This Bear Market Indicator Says Bitcoin Price Is Headed For Crash To $40,000, Here‚Äôs When This shift could suggest that sentiment among active traders is improving, potentially setting the stage for upward price movement if this trend continues. Kesmeci explained: If the Taker Buy Sell Ratio remains above 1.00, especially considering Binance‚Äôs market influence, Bitcoin‚Äôs uptrend from the $76,600 region could see continuation. title: Crypto Industry Super PAC Endorses Republican Candidates in Florida Special Elections
body: A political action committee network backed by the crypto industry is throwing its weight behind two Republican candidates in Florida‚Äôs upcoming special elections for the U.S. House of Representatives, set for April 1. The network includes Fairshake, Protect Progress, and Defend American Jobs, the latter taking the lead in campaign spending, according to a March 21 report from Politico . Defend American Jobs has launched a $1.2 million ad campaign in support of Florida State Senator Randy Fine, who is running to fill the seat vacated by Michael Waltz. Rep. Michael Waltz Resigns to Serve as Trump‚Äôs National Security Adviser Waltz resigned to become President Donald Trump‚Äôs national security adviser. Fine has voiced support for digital innovation, stating on X in January, ‚ÄúFloridians want crypto innovation!‚Äù and emphasizing the need for regulatory clarity in the space. The PAC is also spending $345,000 to support Jimmy Patronis, Florida‚Äôs Chief Financial Officer, in his bid to replace former Representative Matt Gaetz, who briefly accepted a nomination to serve as U.S. Attorney General before withdrawing. Patronis has previously advocated for exploring state investment in digital assets, requesting a feasibility report on using retirement funds for crypto-related investments. Both Fine and Patronis secured victories in their primary elections, with Defend American Jobs spending over $500,000 on Fine‚Äôs campaign and $200,000 on Patronis, according to Federal Election Commission filings. FAIRSHAKE PAC DEPLOYS $700K FOR CRYPTO-FRIENDLY CANDIDATES IN FLORIDA Fairshake supports Jimmy Patronis and Randy Fine in races pivotal to the Republican agenda. This move aligns with Trump‚Äôs pro-crypto appointments, further embedding blockchain in political discourse.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/tcuLNWDJc4 ‚Äî IBC Group Official (@ibcgroupio) January 18, 2025 While the crypto-focused Super PAC Fairshake often supports candidates from both parties, Defend American Jobs has focused nearly all of its financial support on Republican candidates, according to OpenSecrets. The group has raised and spent approximately $60 million between 2023 and 2024. Currently, the U.S. House of Representatives has four vacant seats, including the two in Florida. A full sweep by Democrats would narrow the Republican majority to just one seat, raising the stakes for the April 1 elections. A Shifting Regulatory Landscape Last month, U.S. lawmakers overturned the ‚ÄúDeFi broker rule ,‚Äù a regulation that would require decentralized exchanges and other digital asset brokers to report transaction details to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). The push to repeal the DeFi broker rule came amid a broader shift in U.S. crypto regulation following the Republican Party‚Äôs control of both the Senate and the House. With hundreds of pro-crypto candidates winning seats in Congress, many industry leaders speculate that the U.S. government could become the most crypto-friendly administration in history. The political shift has already had an impact. Throughout February, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) dropped multiple enforcement actions against crypto firms, signaling a change in regulatory tone. As reported, cryptocurrency enforcement in the United States may ease under the upcoming administration of Republican President-elect Donald Trump, with regulatory priorities expected to shift. Speaking at a legal conference in New York, current and former senior government lawyers indicated that while financial fraud cases will still be pursued, the Justice Department‚Äôs focus will likely move toward immigration enforcement, a key campaign promise of Trump. The post Crypto Industry Super PAC Endorses Republican Candidates in Florida Special Elections appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Crypto Fear & Greed Index: Market Sentiment Inches Away From Extreme Fear ‚Äì Should You Be Worried?
body: Navigating the volatile world of cryptocurrency requires more than just technical charts and market caps. Understanding market sentiment is crucial, and the Crypto Fear & Greed Index serves as a vital tool for gauging the emotional temperature of the crypto market. Let‚Äôs dive into the latest reading and what it signifies for your crypto investments. Crypto Fear and Greed Index: A Glimmer of Hope or Still in the Fear Zone? As of March 22nd, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index , a widely tracked metric by Alternative.me , registered a score of 32. This marks a slight uptick of one point from the previous day. While any improvement is welcome, it‚Äôs important to note that the index remains firmly entrenched in the ‚ÄúFear‚Äù zone. This indicates that market participants are still exhibiting significant anxiety and caution in the cryptocurrency space. Decoding the Crypto Sentiment: What Does ‚ÄòFear‚Äô Really Mean? The Fear and Greed Index is not just a random number; it‚Äôs a composite score designed to reflect the overall sentiment of the cryptocurrency market. It operates on a scale of 0 to 100: 0-24: Extreme Fear ‚Äì Suggests investors are extremely worried, potentially indicating a market bottom or oversold conditions. 25-49: Fear ‚Äì Indicates caution and risk aversion among investors, often seen during market corrections or uncertainty. 50-74: Greed ‚Äì Points to increasing optimism and potential for market growth, but also carries the risk of overvaluation. 75-100: Extreme Greed ‚Äì Signals excessive optimism and a potential market bubble, often preceding corrections. Currently, with the index at 32, we are still in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô territory. This implies that while there might be some positive momentum pushing the index up slightly, the overarching feeling in the crypto market is still one of apprehension. Investors are likely hesitant to make bold moves and are prioritizing risk management. Unpacking the Factors: How is the Bitcoin Fear Index Calculated? To provide a holistic view of market sentiment, the Bitcoin fear index (which is used as a proxy for the broader crypto market sentiment) considers a range of diverse factors, each contributing a specific weightage to the final score. These factors are: Volatility (25%): Measures the current volatility and maximum drawdowns of Bitcoin, comparing it with the 30-day and 90-day averages. Unusually high volatility can indicate fear in the market. Market Momentum/Volume (25%): Examines Bitcoin‚Äôs market momentum and trading volume compared to recent averages. High buying volume suggests greed, while low volume can signal fear. Social Media (15%): Analyzes sentiment on social media platforms, particularly Twitter and Reddit, to gauge public opinion on Bitcoin and the crypto market. Surveys (15%): Conducts weekly crypto polls to understand investor sentiment directly. This provides a snapshot of how traders and investors are feeling. Bitcoin Dominance (10%): Tracks Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance in the overall crypto market. Increased dominance can sometimes indicate a flight to safety during fearful times, while decreasing dominance might suggest a higher risk appetite. Google Trends (10%): Analyzes Google Trends data for Bitcoin-related search queries. Spikes in searches like ‚ÄúBitcoin price manipulation‚Äù or ‚ÄúBitcoin crash‚Äù can indicate fear. Cryptocurrency Market Sentiment: Why Does It Matter to You? Understanding cryptocurrency market sentiment , as reflected by the Fear & Greed Index, can offer valuable insights for both short-term traders and long-term investors. Here‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important: Identifying Potential Buying Opportunities: Extreme Fear levels can sometimes present buying opportunities. When everyone is fearful, assets can become undervalued, potentially setting the stage for future price appreciation. Recognizing Potential Selling Opportunities: Conversely, Extreme Greed levels might signal an overheated market. Recognizing this can help investors take profits and reduce risk before potential corrections. Gauging Market Mood: The index provides a quick snapshot of the prevailing market mood, helping you understand the overall psychology driving price movements. Informed Decision Making: By incorporating sentiment analysis into your strategy, you can make more informed trading and investment decisions, rather than solely relying on technical or fundamental analysis. Navigating Fear: Challenges and Considerations While the Fear and Greed Index is a helpful tool, it‚Äôs essential to remember its limitations: Not a Crystal Ball: The index is not a foolproof predictor of market movements. It reflects sentiment, which can be volatile and influenced by unforeseen events. Lagging Indicator: Sentiment can sometimes lag behind actual market changes. It‚Äôs crucial to use it in conjunction with other indicators and analysis methods. Oversimplification: Reducing complex market emotions to a single number can be an oversimplification. Deeper analysis of the underlying factors is always recommended. Market Manipulation: Sentiment itself can be manipulated, particularly in the crypto market. Be wary of relying solely on sentiment-based indicators. Actionable Insights: How to Use the Fear & Greed Index So, how can you effectively use the Fear and Greed Index in your crypto strategy? Combine with Technical Analysis: Use the index to confirm signals from technical indicators. For instance, if technical analysis suggests a potential bottom, and the index is in ‚ÄòExtreme Fear,‚Äô it might strengthen the buy signal. Consider Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): During periods of ‚ÄòFear‚Äô or ‚ÄòExtreme Fear,‚Äô consider employing DCA to gradually build your positions, potentially benefiting from lower prices. Manage Risk: In ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô or ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô zones, consider taking profits, tightening stop-loss orders, or reducing your overall portfolio risk. Stay Informed: Regularly monitor the index and understand the factors driving sentiment changes. This will help you contextualize the index readings and make more informed decisions. Conclusion: Cautious Optimism or Lingering Doubt? The slight rise in the Crypto Fear & Greed Index to 32 offers a sliver of hope, suggesting that the extreme pessimism may be easing slightly. However, the market remains in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone, indicating that significant caution is still warranted. As an investor, staying informed, understanding market sentiment, and using tools like the Fear & Greed Index can empower you to navigate the crypto landscape more effectively. Remember to combine sentiment analysis with your own research and risk management strategies for informed and balanced decision-making in this exciting yet unpredictable market. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Haun Ventures Targets $1 Billion Raise for New Crypto Investment Funds
body: Venture capital firm Haun Ventures is reportedly aiming to raise $1 billion across two new cryptocurrency investment funds within the next three months, according to sources cited by Fortune Crypto on March 21. Half of the funds‚Äî$500 million‚Äîare expected to be dedicated to early-stage crypto startups, while the remaining $500 million will be allocated to late-stage investments in the digital asset space. The effort, if successful, would mark one of the largest crypto-focused capital raises in recent years. Haun Ventures Rose to Prominence in 2022 With $1.5B Debut Fund Founded in 2022 by Katie Haun, a former federal prosecutor and ex-Coinbase board member, Haun Ventures previously made headlines with its impressive $1.5 billion debut fund, launched during more favorable market conditions. Despite setting a lower target this time due to shifting market dynamics, sources suggest Haun expects both new funds to be oversubscribed. The firm has drawn talent from major tech firms, including Airbnb, Coinbase, and Google‚Äôs Jigsaw, and remains active in the crypto venture scene. Most recently, Haun Ventures participated in Bitwise‚Äôs $70 million fundraising round, alongside major investors like Electric Capital, MassMutual, and the MIT Investment Management Company. The current fundraising round is expected to close by June, potentially ranking as one of the largest crypto VC raises since 2022. Comparable efforts include Paradigm‚Äôs $850 million fund closed in June 2024 and Pantera Capital‚Äôs $1 billion blockchain fund drive announced in April. Haun Ventures to raise $1B for new crypto funds Former federal prosecutor Katie Haun is raising $1 billion across two new crypto funds through Haun Ventures, according to Fortune. Set to close in June, the funds will mirror the firm's 2022 structure, with $500 million allocated‚Ä¶ ‚Äî CoinNess Global (@CoinnessGL) March 21, 2025 While Haun Ventures has not disclosed the specific investment focus of the upcoming funds, market analysts anticipate that stablecoins will remain a key area of interest in 2025. Although crypto VC funding reached $13.6 billion in 2024, analysts like Infinity Hedge predict a moderate rebound in 2025‚Äîstill below the $33.8 billion peak in 2021. Crypto VC Funding Rebounds in February, Surging 14.4% Despite Yearly Decline The crypto venture capital (VC) market experienced a strong recovery in February 2025, with total investment volume increasing 14.4% month-over-month, according to a report by Wu Blockchain. A total of 98 publicly disclosed crypto VC deals took place, up from 86 in January. However, despite the monthly growth, funding remained 35.1% lower compared to February 2024, when 151 projects secured investments. Total capital inflows reached $951 million in February, marking a sharp increase from $831 million in January and a 24.3% rise from $765 million recorded a year earlier. The stablecoin sector and payment solutions emerged as the primary investment targets, reflecting the industry‚Äôs shift toward financial infrastructure and transactional stability. Among the top-funded projects, Raise, a gift card startup, secured $63 million in a strategic funding round to integrate crypto payments and stablecoin transactions into its platform. Meanwhile, Plasma, a blockchain firm specializing in stablecoin networks, raised $24 million in its first funding round. As reported, Kaito AI has ranked Paradigm as the top-performing crypto VC firm over the past 12 months, posting an 11.80% performance metric. The firm leads ahead of Alliance (10.64%), Dragonfly (8.32%), a16z (6.94%), and Multicoin Capital (5.86%), which round out the top five. title: Pi Network Price Loses $1 Support Amid Scam Allegations, Will Pi Coin Hit ATH Again?

title: Tether‚Äôs Bold Move: Engaging ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô for USDT Audit ‚Äì A New Era of Transparency?
body: In a potentially groundbreaking move for the stablecoin sector, Tether (USDT), the issuer of the world‚Äôs largest stablecoin, has announced it is in discussions with a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô accounting firm for a comprehensive audit. This revelation, shared by Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino with Reuters, signals a significant step towards greater transparency for a company that has faced persistent scrutiny over the verification of its dollar reserves. Why is a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô Audit a Big Deal for Tether and USDT Reserves? For years, Tether has navigated a landscape of skepticism, primarily due to the lack of a full, publicly available audit from a top-tier accounting firm. Critics have long questioned whether USDT, pegged 1:1 to the US dollar, truly holds sufficient reserves to back its circulating supply. This lack of transparency has cast a shadow over the entire stablecoin market, with concerns ranging from systemic risk to investor protection. Engaging a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô firm ‚Äì Deloitte, Ernst & Young, KPMG, or PricewaterhouseCoopers ‚Äì represents a potential turning point. These firms are globally recognized for their rigorous auditing standards and independence. An audit from one of these giants could provide a level of assurance that Tether‚Äôs previous reserve reports have not achieved. Let‚Äôs break down why this is so crucial: Enhanced Trust and Credibility: A ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô audit can significantly boost trust in Tether and USDT. Their reputation for thoroughness and impartiality carries weight in financial markets. Addressing Regulatory Concerns: Regulators worldwide are increasingly focused on stablecoins. A verified audit could proactively address regulatory concerns and potentially pave the way for wider USDT adoption in regulated environments. Market Confidence: Transparency is paramount in the volatile crypto market. A ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô audit could inject much-needed confidence, potentially attracting more institutional and retail investors to USDT. Industry Standard Setting: If Tether successfully undergoes a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô audit, it could set a new standard for transparency within the stablecoin industry, pushing competitors to follow suit. What are the Challenges and Potential Roadblocks for Tether‚Äôs Crypto Audit? While the announcement is promising, the path to a completed ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô audit is not without potential hurdles. Let‚Äôs consider some of the challenges: Complexity of Tether‚Äôs Reserves: Tether‚Äôs reserves are known to include not just cash and cash equivalents, but also other assets like corporate bonds, loans, and even Bitcoin. Auditing such a diverse and sometimes opaque portfolio can be complex and time-consuming for any accounting firm. Audit Scope and Depth: The devil is in the details. The scope of the audit will be critical. Will it be a full attestation of all reserves, or a more limited engagement? The depth and breadth of the audit will determine its impact on public perception. Timeframe and Completion: Engaging with a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô firm is just the first step. Completing a comprehensive audit can take considerable time. The market will be watching closely for updates and timelines. Delays could breed further speculation. Potential Findings: Audits are designed to uncover discrepancies, if any exist. There is always a possibility that the audit could reveal findings that require Tether to make adjustments to its reserve management or disclosures. How Tether handles any potential findings will be crucial for maintaining trust. Simon McWilliams as CFO: A Strategic Hire for Stablecoin Transparency? Adding another layer to this narrative is Tether‚Äôs recent appointment of Simon McWilliams as its new Chief Financial Officer (CFO). McWilliams brings over 20 years of experience auditing large asset managers. This strategic hire can be interpreted as a clear signal of Tether‚Äôs commitment to strengthening its financial processes and paving the way for more rigorous audits. His expertise will likely be invaluable in navigating the complexities of a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô audit. How does McWilliams‚Äô background align with Tether‚Äôs transparency goals? Area McWilliams‚Äô Expertise Relevance to Tether‚Äôs Audit Auditing Large Asset Managers Experience in verifying complex financial statements and asset portfolios. Crucial for auditing Tether‚Äôs diverse reserve holdings. Financial Reporting Deep understanding of accounting standards and regulatory requirements. Essential for ensuring Tether‚Äôs financial reporting meets ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô scrutiny. Risk Management Familiar with identifying and mitigating financial risks in complex organizations. Important for strengthening Tether‚Äôs risk management framework in anticipation of audits and regulatory oversight. The Future of USDT Reserves and Stablecoin Transparency: What to Expect? Tether‚Äôs engagement with a ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô accounting firm is a significant development in the ongoing quest for stablecoin transparency. While challenges remain, this move signals a potential shift towards greater accountability in the stablecoin space. The outcome of these discussions and the subsequent audit (if completed) will be closely watched by the crypto community, regulators, and traditional financial institutions alike. For investors and users of USDT, this news offers a glimmer of hope for increased confidence in the stablecoin. For the broader crypto market, it could represent a crucial step towards maturity and mainstream adoption. Ultimately, the success of this endeavor hinges on the completion of a comprehensive and transparent audit that satisfies market expectations and regulatory demands. The coming months will be critical in determining whether Tether‚Äôs ‚ÄòBig Four‚Äô engagement truly marks a new era of transparency for USDT and the stablecoin ecosystem. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Tesla sees $8 billion retail inflow over 13-day buying frenzy amid plummeting prices
body: Retail traders just poured $8.1 billion into Tesla stock over 13 straight trading days. That‚Äôs not some random hype‚Äîit‚Äôs the biggest retail buying streak by dollar amount in more than ten years, according to JPMorgan. Emma Wu, a strategist there, said , ‚ÄúWhile this is not the longest consecutive streak of retail buying in TSLA, it is the highest magnitude among all past ‚Äòbuying streaks‚Äô in over a decade.‚Äù Retail is clearly still deep in buy-the-dip mode. Wu said these trades show that small investors are hunting for opportunities while the market as a whole slides into correction. But as retail piles in, the ones running Tesla are quietly heading for the exits. Insiders dump hundreds of millions while retail buys the dip Since November, Tesla insiders have sold off $335.2 million worth of stock. The group includes board members, the CFO, and even Kimbal Elon, Elon‚Äôs brother. Most of those shares were unloaded when the price was between $300 and $400. Meanwhile, the stock was sitting at $242 as of Friday. James Murdoch, a Tesla board director, sold $12.9 million worth of shares on March 10 at around $240 per share. While insiders took profits, Elon Musk tried to keep morale alive. Speaking to employees during a town hall Thursday evening, he said, ‚ÄúIf you read the news, it feels like armageddon. I can‚Äôt walk past the TV without seeing a Tesla on fire. What‚Äôs going on?‚Äù He urged staff to hold their shares, saying the real value will show when autonomous driving hits the market. ‚ÄúSo what I am saying is, ‚ÄòHang on to your stock,‚Äô‚Äù Elon told employees. That didn‚Äôt stop the bleeding on the chart though. Even with a 40% gain over the past year, Tesla shares have still crashed 40% in 2025 alone, hit by weak sales and market fears. The company‚Äôs latest financials didn‚Äôt help. For Q4 2024, revenue came in at $25.71 billion, only a 2% increase, and missed forecasts of $27.26 billion. Automotive revenue dropped 8% to $19.8 billion because of cheaper vehicle prices. Operating income fell 23% to $1.6 billion, and net income collapsed 71% to $2.32 billion. That was partly due to a one-time tax benefit that helped last year‚Äôs numbers look better. The company also saw its first yearly drop in deliveries, with just under 1.8 million vehicles shipped for 2024. High valuation draws criticism as RSI hits oversold levels Tesla‚Äôs forward P/E ratio is now sitting at 92.4x, compared to the sector average of 15.1x. That‚Äôs a massive gap, and with slowing growth and rising competition, some investors are asking how long the company can justify that kind of premium. But not everyone‚Äôs bearish. Rich Ross at Evercore ISI said the stock is in an ‚Äúextremely oversold condition.‚Äù He pointed to a Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 32, which is way down from its former peak of 72. ‚ÄúWhen you have a trillion-dollar company with a 32 RSI and a market cap that has decreased by 55%, that‚Äôs an extremely oversold condition,‚Äù Ross said. ‚ÄúThe risk-reward scenario becomes quite appealing given the extreme levels in terms of price and momentum.‚Äù But outside of stock charts, the brand is getting attacked on the ground. Boycotts, protests, vandalism, and arson have hit Tesla showrooms, EVs, and charging stations in both the U.S. and Europe. These moves have been tied to Elon‚Äôs involvement in the Trump White House, which continues to stir backlash. Elon pushes tech vision as trade risks and sales decline hit Elon spent most of the town hall promoting what‚Äôs coming next. He claimed that a future with robotaxis, AI, and humanoid robots will change everything. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the most exciting future that you could possibly imagine?‚Äù he asked employees. Then he answered: ‚ÄúA future of abundance for all,‚Äù where people ‚Äúcould literally just have anything you want.‚Äù He also bragged about the Model Y, saying it would be the best-selling car on Earth again this year, and called it ‚Äúavailable worldwide.‚Äù The Cybertruck, despite getting hit with a massive recall the same day, was still promoted by Elon as the top-selling fully electric pickup, and he said it scored a 5-star crash rating. He also gave a shoutout to Tesla employees who helped get the refreshed Model Y to market, saying supply chains across three continents made it hard, but they pulled through. He hyped the upcoming Cybercab, a two-seater with no steering wheel or brakes, which will eventually run on Tesla‚Äôs robotaxi software via an update. That‚Äôs a promise Elon has been making since 2016, when he said Tesla owners would be able to take a driverless road trip across the U.S. by the end of 2018. That never happened. Tesla‚Äôs sales are also slipping. New vehicle sales are falling in Europe, China, and parts of the U.S. The company is facing more problems due to tariffs put in place by President Trump through executive orders. These hit materials from Canada, Mexico, and China‚Äîall key supply sources for Tesla‚Äôs production. According to Edmunds, more Tesla owners are trading in their EVs than ever before. That data lines up with the broader frustration being felt in the market and on the streets. Still, on Friday, Tesla stock jumped 5.3% to $248.71 after Elon‚Äôs team meeting. Elon tried to offer some kind of hope. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very difficult like for people in the stock market, especially those that look in the rearview mirror ‚Äî which is most people ‚Äî to imagine a future where suddenly a 10 million vehicle fleet has five to ten times the usefulness,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so profound and there‚Äôs no comparison with anything in the past that it does not compute. But it will compute in the future.‚Äù Whether Wall Street buys that story or not is a different question. Cryptopolitan Academy: Coming Soon - A New Way to Earn Passive Income with DeFi in 2025. Learn More

title: Tether Collaborates with Big Four Auditor to Verify 1:1 Backing for USDT Stablecoin
body: Tether, the issuer behind the world‚Äôs largest stablecoin USDT, is reportedly working with a Big Four accounting firm to conduct an audit of its reserves and confirm that each token is backed 1:1 with assets. The move comes amid growing industry pressure for transparency, especially in light of past controversies surrounding the company‚Äôs claims. Speaking to Reuters on March 21 , Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino said that a full audit is a top priority for the firm. Tether CEO Says Trump‚Äôs Pro-Crypto Stance Could Ease Audit Process Ardoino noted that the process could be smoother under the pro-crypto stance of U.S. President Donald Trump, who has signaled support for greater integration of digital assets. ‚ÄúIf the President of the United States says this is top priority for the US, Big Four auditing firms will have to listen,‚Äù he stated. While Ardoino confirmed ongoing discussions with one of the four major firms ‚Äî PwC, EY, Deloitte, or KPMG ‚Äî he did not specify which was involved. Tether currently publishes quarterly attestations, but these fall short of a full independent annual audit, which would provide stronger assurance to regulators and investors. Tether‚Äôs USDT is designed to maintain a stable value pegged to the U.S. dollar, claiming each token is backed by a reserve made up of cash, equivalents, and other assets. Critics, however, have long questioned the accuracy and completeness of these claims. Tether just released the attestation for Q4 2024. Highlights as of 31st December 2024: ‚Äì $13.7 billion profit for year 2024 ‚Äì ~$6 billion profit for Q4 2024 ‚Äì $113 billion in direct and indirect holdings ‚Äì $7 billion in Tether's excess stablecoin reserves (36% increase YoY),‚Ä¶ https://t.co/izYONstKuF ‚Äî Paolo Ardoino (@paoloardoino) January 31, 2025 To strengthen its financial operations, Tether recently hired Simon McWilliams as Chief Financial Officer, signaling a more serious approach to conducting a full audit. In September 2024, critics like Cyber Capital founder Justin Bons labeled Tether a major threat to the crypto ecosystem, citing the lack of independent verification of its reserves. His concerns echoed the findings of Consumers‚Äô Research, a watchdog that also questioned Tether‚Äôs transparency. Tether was previously fined $41 million in 2021 by the CFTC for misrepresenting its reserve backing. More recently, it has pushed back against European regulations under MiCA, which prompted exchanges like Crypto.com to delist USDT and other tokens. Tether Engages With U.S. Lawmakers to Shape Federal Stablecoin Regulations Last month, it was revealed that Tether has engaged with U.S. lawmakers to help shape federal regulations for the stablecoin sector. As reported, the company has been in discussions with Representatives Bryan Steil and French Hill, key figures behind the STABLE Act introduced on Feb. 6. Ardoino reportedly confirmed that the company is also seeking to contribute to two additional stablecoin bills proposed by other legislators. More recently, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell affirmed the central bank‚Äôs support for developing a regulatory framework around stablecoins during a Senate hearing on February 11. Powell stated that the Federal Reserve supports the creation of a regulatory framework for stablecoins , noting the importance of protecting consumers and savers. The post Tether Collaborates with Big Four Auditor to Verify 1:1 Backing for USDT Stablecoin appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Solana (SOL) vs. Mutuum Finance (MUTM): Which Crypto Are Whales Accumulating?
body: The post Solana (SOL) vs. Mutuum Finance (MUTM): Which Crypto Are Whales Accumulating? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News As institutional investors and crypto whales continue to adjust their portfolios, the competition between established blockchain networks and emerging projects intensifies. Solana (SOL), a well-known high-performance blockchain, has been a popular choice for major investors. However, with new opportunities emerging in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) has begun attracting significant attention. With its presale gaining momentum and utilities set to go live post-launch, many are questioning which of these two assets whales are favoring for the next growth cycle. Solana (SOL) Solana has maintained its reputation as one of the fastest and most scalable blockchains, boasting low transaction fees and high throughput. Despite its strong fundamentals, SOL has faced periods of price stagnation, with on-chain activity and network growth showing mixed signals in recent months. While total value locked (TVL) in Solana-based DeFi projects has increased, user engagement across decentralized applications (dApps) has been inconsistent. Whale activity on Solana has also fluctuated, with large holders adjusting their positions based on broader market trends. While some investors continue to hold SOL as a long-term bet on blockchain scalability, others have begun diversifying into alternative assets, seeking projects with lower market caps and higher growth potential. This shift in capital allocation has led some analysts to speculate that whales may be looking beyond Solana for their next major investment. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) While Solana remains a dominant force in the crypto space, Mutuum Finance is emerging as a promising alternative, especially among DeFi-focused investors. The project has been gaining momentum in its presale phase, with over $4.4 million raised and more than 60% of Phase 3 already completed. Currently priced at $0.02, the token is set for a 25% price increase in the next phase, driving significant demand from investors looking to enter early. Shortly after its launch, MUTM is expected to surge by 1200%, fueled by its structured financial model, growing investor demand, and increasing utility within the DeFi space. As the token becomes available on major exchanges and its lending platform goes live, analysts predict a strong price rally, making early investments highly rewarding. Mutuum Finance operates as a decentralized lending and borrowing platform, providing a sustainable financial ecosystem where users can earn passive income by supplying assets or access liquidity without selling their holdings. Unlike speculative projects, MUTM‚Äôs value is driven by real-world utility, making it an attractive option for institutional investors seeking stability alongside growth potential. One major factor contributing to whale interest in Mutuum Finance is its buy-and-distribute mechanism, which ensures continuous buy pressure and rewards long-term holders. The protocol allocates a portion of its fees to purchasing MUTM from the market, redistributing it to mtTOKEN holders. This system not only incentivizes participation but also supports price appreciation over time. Additionally, the team is preparing for a beta launch of its lending platform, set to go live alongside the token‚Äôs official listing. This early functionality ensures that MUTM will have immediate utility, attracting both retail and institutional investors looking for real-world use cases in the DeFi sector. With its structured presale, growing community, and upcoming exchange listings, analysts predict that MUTM could experience exponential growth once trading begins. Many early investors see this as an opportunity to secure holdings at a low price before broader market adoption accelerates demand. Which Crypto Are Whales Favoring? While Solana remains a well-established asset with strong fundamentals, some whale investors appear to be shifting their focus toward projects like Mutuum Finance that offer higher upside potential. With DeFi adoption continuing to expand, projects that introduce real utility and structured financial models are gaining traction among institutional investors. With MUTM expected to surge post-launch, the presale is rapidly selling out as investors look to secure their positions before wider market exposure. As more whales accumulate MUTM, it is becoming evident that this DeFi project could be one of the biggest contenders in the coming months, offering both short-term potential and long-term sustainability. title: Revolutionary Move: Fidelity Launches Tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund to Rival BlackRock
body: Get ready for a thrilling showdown in the world of digital assets! Fidelity Investments, a financial giant, is poised to launch its own tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund , directly challenging BlackRock‚Äôs pioneering BUIDL fund. This exciting development, first reported by AggrNews on X, signals a significant escalation in the institutional adoption of tokenized assets and promises to reshape how investors engage with traditional financial instruments in the crypto space. What is a Tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund and Why is it Groundbreaking? Let‚Äôs break down what a tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund actually means and why it‚Äôs causing such a stir. Imagine owning a piece of U.S. government debt, one of the safest assets globally, but in a digital, easily transferable form. That‚Äôs essentially what tokenization achieves. Instead of traditional shares or bonds, investors receive digital tokens representing ownership in a fund that holds U.S. Treasury bills. Here‚Äôs why this is a groundbreaking move: Accessibility: Tokenization can lower the barriers to entry for investing in U.S. Treasuries. Traditionally, accessing these markets might involve brokerage accounts and minimum investment amounts. Tokenized funds can potentially fractionalize ownership, allowing smaller investors to participate. Efficiency and Speed: Transactions with tokens on a blockchain can be faster and more efficient than traditional settlement processes. This can lead to quicker access to funds and potentially lower transaction costs. 24/7 Trading: Unlike traditional markets with set trading hours, digital assets can be traded around the clock, offering greater flexibility for investors globally. Transparency: Blockchain technology provides a transparent and auditable record of transactions, enhancing trust and security. The introduction of a tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund by Fidelity marks a crucial step in bridging the gap between traditional finance and the burgeoning world of cryptocurrencies. It‚Äôs about taking a well-established, secure asset class and making it more accessible, efficient, and modern through blockchain technology. Fidelity vs. BlackRock: The Battle for Institutional Crypto Adoption Heats Up Fidelity‚Äôs entry into the tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund arena is not happening in a vacuum. It‚Äôs a direct challenge to BlackRock, the world‚Äôs largest asset manager, and their existing BUIDL fund. BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL, launched earlier, has already made waves in the industry, demonstrating the appetite for tokenized versions of traditional financial products. Now, with Fidelity joining the fray, the competition is set to intensify, accelerating institutional crypto adoption . This competition is healthy for the market and offers investors more choices. Here‚Äôs a glimpse of what this rivalry could mean: Feature Fidelity Tokenized Fund (Expected) BlackRock BUIDL (Existing) Asset Focus U.S. Treasury Bills U.S. Treasury Bills Issuer Fidelity Investments BlackRock Competition Direct competitor to BUIDL First mover advantage Impact Potentially expands market, offers more options Established proof of concept, set industry benchmark The entrance of Fidelity, a respected and established player in traditional finance, validates the tokenization benefits and further legitimizes the concept of bringing real-world assets onto the blockchain. It signals to other institutions that tokenization is not just a niche experiment but a serious evolution in financial markets. Unveiling the Benefits of Fidelity Tokenized Fund: What‚Äôs in it for Investors? So, why should investors be excited about the potential launch of a Fidelity tokenized fund ? The advantages are multifaceted and cater to both institutional and potentially retail investors: Diversification: Adding a tokenized U.S. Treasury fund to a portfolio can offer diversification benefits, especially in volatile market conditions. U.S. Treasuries are generally considered low-risk assets. Yield Potential: While Treasury bills are low-yield, they provide a relatively stable return. Tokenized funds offer a way to access this yield within the crypto ecosystem. Integration with DeFi: Tokenized Treasuries can potentially be integrated into Decentralized Finance (DeFi) protocols, opening up new avenues for yield generation and financial applications. Imagine using your tokenized Treasury holdings as collateral in DeFi lending platforms. Simplified Access to Traditional Assets: For crypto-native investors, tokenized Treasuries offer a bridge to traditional finance without needing to navigate complex traditional brokerage systems. However, it‚Äôs crucial to remember that this is a developing space. Regulations are still evolving, and investors should conduct thorough research and understand the risks associated with both cryptocurrencies and tokenized assets. Details about Fidelity‚Äôs fund, such as fees, minimum investment, and platform, will be crucial in determining its attractiveness to investors. BlackRock BUIDL: Setting the Stage for Tokenized Assets Before Fidelity‚Äôs move, BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL fund already demonstrated the viability and appeal of tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund products. BUIDL, built on the Ethereum blockchain, provided a blueprint for how traditional asset managers can enter the tokenization space. Its success likely played a role in encouraging Fidelity to launch its own competing product. BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL fund‚Äôs existence has: Educated the Market: BUIDL helped educate both institutional and retail investors about the concept of tokenized Treasuries and their potential benefits. Established Infrastructure: Its launch contributed to the development of necessary infrastructure and regulatory discussions around tokenized real-world assets. Demonstrated Demand: The fund‚Äôs traction proved that there is genuine demand for these types of products, paving the way for more entrants like Fidelity. The competition between Fidelity and BlackRock is not just about market share; it‚Äôs about driving innovation and accelerating the adoption of tokenization across the financial industry. BlackRock‚Äôs pioneering efforts laid the groundwork, and now Fidelity is stepping in to amplify the impact. The Future is Tokenized: Exploring the Broader Implications of Tokenization Benefits The launch of a tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund by Fidelity, following BlackRock‚Äôs lead, is more than just two firms competing. It‚Äôs a powerful signal about the future of finance. Tokenization benefits extend far beyond U.S. Treasuries and can revolutionize various asset classes, including: Real Estate: Tokenizing real estate can fractionalize ownership, increase liquidity, and simplify property transactions. Commodities: Tokenized commodities can streamline supply chains, improve transparency, and facilitate easier trading. Equities: Tokenizing stocks could lead to faster settlement times, reduced costs, and potentially 24/7 trading. Private Equity and Debt: Tokenization can democratize access to private markets, making them available to a broader range of investors. The momentum behind institutional crypto adoption and tokenization is undeniable. As more financial institutions embrace this technology, we can expect to see a proliferation of tokenized assets, transforming how we invest, trade, and interact with financial markets. Fidelity‚Äôs move is a bold step into this tokenized future, promising to bring the advantages of blockchain technology to mainstream finance. In conclusion, Fidelity‚Äôs planned launch of a tokenized U.S. Treasury Fund is a groundbreaking development in the crypto and traditional finance worlds. It intensifies the competition with BlackRock, validates the concept of tokenized assets, and underscores the growing trend of institutional crypto adoption . For investors, this means more choices, potentially greater efficiency, and a glimpse into a future where traditional and digital finance are seamlessly integrated. Keep an eye on this space ‚Äì the tokenized revolution is just getting started! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Bithumb Lists ACX, the Cross-Chain Protocol, as Price Surges 44% in 24 Hours: Next Stop $0.71?
body: South Korea‚Äôs second-largest exchange adds Across Protocol to its KRW market ACX/KRW trading begins March 22, 2025, at 6 PM local time ACX has gained 44% in 24 hours, eyeing the $0.71 mark after its newest funding South Korea‚Äôs second-largest cryptocurrency exchange, Bithumb, has announced the listing of Across Protocol (ACX) on its KRW market. Across Protocol operates as a decentralized cross-chain bridge, designed for secure and efficient transfers of digital assets between different blockchain networks. title: Fidelity Launches Solana Fund, Expanding Crypto Offerings
body: The post Fidelity Launches Solana Fund, Expanding Crypto Offerings appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Fidelity has officially registered the ‚ÄúFidelity Solana Fund‚Äù in Delaware, marking another step in its expanding crypto investment strategy. This fund offers institutional investors direct exposure to Solana (SOL), a blockchain known for its speed and scalability. Following its Bitcoin and Ethereum products, Fidelity‚Äôs move signals growing confidence in alternative crypto assets. As major financial firms continue embracing blockchain technology, Solana‚Äôs inclusion in Fidelity‚Äôs portfolio further strengthens institutional adoption of digital assets.

title: Explosive Bitcoin ETF Demand: $83.1M Inflows Ignite Market Excitement
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The U.S. Spot Bitcoin ETF market is heating up, and the latest data is nothing short of electrifying. On March 21st, these investment vehicles collectively pulled in a staggering $83.1 million in net inflows. This marks the sixth consecutive day of positive momentum, signaling a robust and sustained investor appetite for Bitcoin exposure through ETFs. Are we witnessing the dawn of a new era for crypto investment? Let‚Äôs dive into the details and uncover what‚Äôs driving this surge and what it means for the future of Bitcoin. What‚Äôs Fueling the Bitcoin ETF Inflows Frenzy? The consistent Bitcoin ETF inflows are painting a compelling picture of growing institutional and retail interest in cryptocurrencies. But what exactly is behind this bullish trend? Several factors could be at play: Increased Institutional Adoption: Major players in the financial world are increasingly recognizing Bitcoin as a legitimate asset class. Spot Bitcoin ETFs provide a regulated and accessible avenue for institutions to gain exposure to Bitcoin without directly holding the digital asset. Simplified Investment Route for Retail Investors: For everyday investors, navigating the complexities of cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets can be daunting. Spot Bitcoin ETFs listed on traditional stock exchanges offer a familiar and straightforward way to invest in Bitcoin through brokerage accounts they already manage. Positive Market Sentiment: The overall sentiment surrounding Bitcoin has been largely positive, fueled by factors like halving anticipation, growing mainstream acceptance, and potential for future price appreciation. This positive outlook naturally attracts more investment into Bitcoin-related products like ETFs. Diversification Benefits: Investors are constantly seeking diversification to mitigate risk. Bitcoin, with its low correlation to traditional assets, presents an attractive diversification opportunity, and ETFs make it easier to incorporate Bitcoin into a diversified portfolio. BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT: The Star Performer in the Spot Bitcoin ETF Arena Among the suite of Spot Bitcoin ETFs available in the U.S., BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT is emerging as a clear leader. On March 21st, IBIT alone raked in a remarkable $105 million in net inflows. This impressive figure underscores BlackRock‚Äôs brand recognition, its extensive distribution network, and the confidence investors have in its ETF management capabilities. IBIT‚Äôs consistent positive inflows are a testament to its growing popularity and its role in attracting significant capital into the Bitcoin market. Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC: Navigating Outflows Amidst Overall Growth While the overall trend for Bitcoin ETF inflows is overwhelmingly positive, Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC continues to experience net outflows. On March 21st, GBTC saw a net outflow of $21.9 million. This outflow is a continuation of a trend that began when GBTC converted from a trust to an ETF. Several factors contribute to these outflows: Factor Description Higher Fees: GBTC‚Äôs management fees are comparatively higher than newer spot Bitcoin ETFs, making competitors like IBIT more attractive from a cost perspective. Profit Taking: Investors who held GBTC shares prior to its ETF conversion may be taking profits, especially after the significant price appreciation of Bitcoin. Rotation to Lower-Fee ETFs: Some investors might be rotating out of GBTC and into lower-fee spot Bitcoin ETFs to optimize their investment returns. Despite the outflows, GBTC remains a significant player in the Bitcoin ETF space, holding a substantial amount of Bitcoin. The outflows, while noteworthy, need to be viewed in the context of the overall robust inflows into the broader spot Bitcoin ETF market. What Does This Mean for the Future of Bitcoin and Crypto Investments? The sustained Bitcoin ETF inflows are undeniably a bullish signal for the cryptocurrency market. They indicate: Increased Liquidity: ETFs enhance liquidity in the Bitcoin market by providing an easily tradable instrument. Price Support: Consistent inflows can create buying pressure, potentially supporting and driving up the price of Bitcoin. Mainstream Legitimacy: The success of spot Bitcoin ETFs further solidifies Bitcoin‚Äôs position as a mainstream asset class, attracting a wider range of investors. Catalyst for Further Innovation: The ETF success could pave the way for more innovative crypto investment products and further integration of digital assets into traditional finance. Actionable Insights: Navigating the Bitcoin ETF Landscape For investors considering Bitcoin ETF investments, here are some actionable insights: Due Diligence is Key: Research different spot Bitcoin ETFs, compare their fees, track records, and custodians. Understand Your Risk Tolerance: Bitcoin and crypto investments are inherently volatile. Assess your risk appetite before allocating capital. Consider Long-Term Perspective: Bitcoin ETFs are best viewed as long-term investments within a diversified portfolio. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of market trends, regulatory developments, and news impacting the crypto space to make informed investment decisions. Conclusion: A Powerful Wave of Institutional Adoption The $83.1 million net inflow into U.S. Spot Bitcoin ETFs on March 21st is more than just a number; it represents a powerful wave of institutional and retail adoption washing over the cryptocurrency market. BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT is leading the charge, while even Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC, despite outflows, remains a significant force. As inflows continue and market maturity progresses, spot Bitcoin ETFs are poised to play an increasingly crucial role in shaping the future of Bitcoin and the broader digital asset ecosystem. The excitement is palpable, and the journey has just begun. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption.

title: XRP News: Lawyer Questions Donald Trump Government‚Äôs Lean Towards Bitcoin
body: XRP news: the ongoing rivalry between Bitcoin maximalists and the Ripple community has escalated, fueled by perceptions that the Trump government favors Bitcoin. Notably, President Donald Trump‚Äôs pledge to transform the United States into a crypto capital has sparked intense debate, particularly regarding the government‚Äôs favoritism towards Bitcoin. Reflecting on the matter, XRP lawyer Bill Morgan has expressed concerns that the administration‚Äôs apparent preference for Bitcoin may hinder its goal of leading crypto innovation. XRP News: How Will Trump Government‚Äôs Bitcoin Preference Affect US Goal? Despite the enthusiasm surrounding President Donald Trump‚Äôs crypto objectives and pledges, there‚Äôs growing uncertainty about his plans‚Äô limitations and potential drawbacks. While Trump vows to turn America into a crypto capital, XRP lawyer Bill Morgan raises concerns over the government‚Äôs preference for Bitcoin over other cryptocurrencies. In response to key administrative officials‚Äô increasing promotion of Bitcoin, Bill Morgan stated, ‚ÄúThe new Administration claims to be all about making the USA the leader of innovation and crypto, yet all we hear about from the people involved is bitcoin, bitcoin, bitcoin.‚Äù Trump Government‚Äôs Bitcoin Favoritism Compromises Crypto Innovation As highlighted by the XRP lawyer Bill Morgan, the US government‚Äôs goal of transforming America into a crypto capital is at risk due to the administration‚Äôs lean towards Bitcoin. This bias could stifle innovation in other areas of the crypto space, ultimately undermining the administration‚Äôs goal. Experts argue that Bitcoin maximalism overlooks the potential of altcoins and other blockchain innovations, such as smart contracts and decentralized finance (DeFi). This narrow focus might lead to missed opportunities for growth and adoption in the broader blockchain ecosystem. Balance Between Bitcoin Promotion and Crypto Growth In a recent post, XRP lawyer Bill Morgan shared a thought-provoking question he posed to GROK, sparking an in-depth response. The question read, Is there a serious risk that despite the stated objective of the current US administration of leading crypto innovation that the administration is giving such a preference to bitcoin that American leadership of crypto innovation will be compromised. Surprisingly, he received a nuanced answer that highlighted the delicate balance between promoting Bitcoin and nurturing the broader crypto ecosystem. The response noted that the US administration‚Äôs preference for Bitcoin might strengthen one pillar of crypto leadership, though it‚Äôs not yet clear if it compromises the foundation as a whole. However, the platform added that if Bitcoin becomes an overriding obsession, the US might dominate a single lane while losing the race in others. Recently, Bill Morgan emphasized XRP‚Äôs positive track in response to SEC‚Äôs decision to drop the lawsuit, defying the bearish market trends of Bitcoin. Bitcoin vs XRP: The Rivalry continues The long-standing rivalry between XRP supporters and Bitcoin maxis continues. Donald Trump‚Äôs plans for a US crypto reserve, which would include XRP and other altcoins alongside Bitcoin, have sparked a heated debate. Bitcoin maxi Samson Mow highlighted the significance of a Bitcoin reserve, hailing it a game-changer. While critics like Peter Schiff questioned the government‚Äôs decision to add XRP to the reserve, Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson appreciated Trump‚Äôs decision. The post XRP News: Lawyer Questions Donald Trump Government‚Äôs Lean Towards Bitcoin appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Unveiling Tell A Tale (TAT): The Exciting New Addition to Binance Alpha
body: In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, staying ahead of the curve means identifying promising projects early on. What is Binance Alpha and Why Does it Matter for New Crypto Token Discoveries? Think of Binance Alpha as a dedicated observatory within the vast Binance ecosystem. Its mission is simple yet crucial: to identify and showcase early-stage crypto projects that exhibit significant growth potential. In a market saturated with thousands of cryptocurrencies, distinguishing genuine innovation from fleeting trends can be a daunting task. Binance Alpha considers factors like community engagement, market trends, and project innovation. This curation saves you time and effort in sifting through countless projects on your own. Increased Visibility for Projects: For projects like Tell A Tale (TAT), inclusion in Binance Alpha is a significant boost. Tell A Tale (TAT): A Deep Dive into the New Binance Alpha Token So, let‚Äôs turn our attention to the star of the hour: Tell A Tale (TAT). Unlocking Crypto Growth Potential: What Does Binance Alpha Mean for Investors? title: Bitcoin Primed for Major Moves As Macroeconomic Conditions Ease, Says Analyst Jamie Coutts ‚Äì Here‚Äôs His Outlook
body: Real Vision‚Äôs chief crypto analyst says that Bitcoin ( BTC ) may soon print a series of rallies as macroeconomic conditions could ease later this year. In a new thread, crypto strategist Jamie Coutts tells his 37,300 followers on the social media platform X that market liquidity is expected to increase in the second half of 2025, which may pump Bitcoin. ‚ÄúThe bottom line, though, is that if Bitcoin can rally through the worst liquidity withdrawal in decades, it‚Äôs primed for more significant moves as conditions ease through the rest of the year. Watch the blue line [Base Money Liquidity to Debt Ratio] begin to tick higher in 2H (second half) of the year.‚Äù Source: Jamie Coutts/X In addition to predicting money supply will increase faster than US debt, he also predicts that Bitcoin adoption will increase among US banks and sovereign wealth funds, helping to increase the value of the flagship crypto asset. ‚ÄúMore likely, base money outpaces government debt growth. What happens if base money expands faster than U.S. debt growth? In some reality, that might steady the ship and dampen the fear fueling Bitcoin adoption. But, in my view, that only hits the margins. Meanwhile, deeper Bitcoin integration at both sovereign and banking levels is inevitable. Ultimately, US structural deficits are not changing. The US government will need to find new and inventive ways to ensure there is a bid for their debt.‚Äù Bitcoin is trading for $84,090 at time of writing, flat on the day. title: Spot Bitcoin ETF Inflows Hit $785 Million This Week, $90K BTC Price Soon?
body: Spot Bitcoin ETFs in the United States have once again gained momentum recording six consecutive days of inflows. This week, the net inflows surged to $785 million with BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT and Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC playing a crucial role. Market analysts are hopeful that these institutional inflows could push BTC price to $90K and further. Bitcoin ETF Inflows Surge Sharply After the first two consecutive weeks of outflows in March 2025, spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded inflows for the past six consecutive trading sessions. This shows that institutional interest in Bitcoin has been picking up once again as BTC price continues to flirt around $83,000 levels. As per the data from Farside Investors , the BTC ETFs saw inflows of $755 million over the past week. Of these BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) alone contributed $486 million. Other players like Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC clocked $70 million of inflows while Ark Invest‚Äôs ARKB saw just over $100 million inflows during this period. Source: Trader T Institutional Demand for BTC on the Rise As seen with spot Bitcoin ETFs, the institutional demand for Bitcoin has been rising pretty fast. On-chain data shows that the demand for BTC has reached the highest levels since the collapse of the FTX exchange. According to recent data, new investors have accumulated 172,705 BTC since February 23, highlighting renewed interest and confidence in the cryptocurrency market. Source: CryptoQuant Crypto analyst Trader T has highlighted the potential for significant inflows into Bitcoin from U.S. pension funds and Target Date Funds (TDFs). Citing data from Grok, the analyst believes that $103‚Äì122 billion could enter the US equity market from these sources. According to Trader T, there could be a plausible allocation of 5‚Äì10% of this amount to alternative asset classes, such as Bitcoin. Thus, it could result in a $1‚Äì2 billion inflow into the leading cryptocurrency. BTC Price Surge to $90K Soon? Over the past week, the BTC price volatility has dropped while Bitcoin ETF inflows have continued. Bitcoin has flirted around $83,000 recently with analysts expecting a potential breakout above $84,000 soon. Popular crypto analyst Altcoin Sherpa stated that he expects BTC to surge to $90,000 before making any other significant move. ‚ÄúIt could go to 75k eventually, sure, but I think it‚Äôd go to 89-90k before that time. Basically, we‚Äôre headed to 90k minimum IMO,‚Äù he wrote. Some market analysts predict the Bitcoin price rally to further continue to $114K. Source: Altcoin Sherpa The post Spot Bitcoin ETF Inflows Hit $785 Million This Week, $90K BTC Price Soon? appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Crypto Super PACs Rally Behind Republican Candidates in Florida‚Äôs Special Elections
body: A powerful network of crypto Super PACs is making its influence felt in Florida‚Äôs upcoming April 1 special elections for the U.S. House of Representatives. According to a March 21 report by Politico, the network‚Äîcomprising Fairshake, Defend American Jobs, and Protect Progress‚Äîis pouring significant funds into backing two Republican candidates vying for congressional seats. Leading the charge is Defend American Jobs, which is set to spend $1.2 million on ad campaigns supporting Florida State Senator Randy Fine. Fine is aiming to replace Michael Waltz, who vacated his House seat to serve as President Donald Trump‚Äôs national security adviser. Known for his pro-crypto stance, Fine has previously advocated for ‚Äúclear rules of the road‚Äù to foster digital asset innovation, declaring on X in January, ‚ÄúFloridians want crypto innovation!‚Äù In addition, the Super PAC will spend $345,000 to promote Florida Chief Financial Officer Jimmy Patronis, who is competing for the seat formerly held by Matt Gaetz. Gaetz resigned after Trump nominated him for U.S. Attorney General, a position he later withdrew from. Patronis, an outspoken crypto supporter, previously proposed allocating part of Florida‚Äôs retirement funds toward digital asset investments, highlighting his commitment to integrating crypto into the state‚Äôs financial framework. Crypto PACs Are Betting Big The April 1 elections carry significant weight, as they are part of four current vacancies in the U.S. House of Representatives. With two of those seats in Florida, the outcomes could tighten the House‚Äôs power dynamics. If Democrats were to win all four seats, Republicans would be left with just a one-person advantage in the chamber‚Äîa precariously slim majority. Defend American Jobs, a rising force in the crypto-political sphere , has already made substantial financial commitments. During the January primaries, the PAC spent over $500,000 backing Fine and $200,000 supporting Patronis. Both candidates emerged victorious in their respective districts‚ÄîFlorida‚Äôs 6th and 1st‚Äîpaving the way for their general election bids. Growing Influence in U.S. Politics While Fairshake tends to support candidates across party lines , Defend American Jobs leans heavily Republican. According to OpenSecrets, the PAC spent nearly $60 million from 2023 to 2024, almost exclusively backing GOP candidates. This crypto-political influence underscores the industry‚Äôs growing presence in shaping U.S. policy, particularly in states like Florida, where lawmakers are increasingly embracing digital asset innovation. The post Crypto Super PACs Rally Behind Republican Candidates in Florida‚Äôs Special Elections appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .
