title: Bitcoin (BTC) Poised for a Massive Surge or a Shocking Collapse ‚Äì Critical Levels to Watch
body: Bitcoin (BTC) is currently trading at $84,339, with bulls making repeated attempts to break the critical $84,400 resistance level. This zone has seen intense buying pressure, as traders accumulate strength, positioning BTC for a potential breakout. The next few price movements will be crucial in determining whether BTC enters a new bullish phase or faces a correction. Key Resistance and Support Levels to Watch Resistance Levels: $84,400 ‚Äì This is the immediate resistance level where BTC has faced multiple rejections. A strong push above this zone could confirm bullish dominance. $87,000 ‚Äì If BTC successfully breaks above $84,400, the next significant target would be $87,000, potentially leading to more buying momentum. $90,000 ‚Äì This psychological level has been a long-awaited target for buyers. A successful close above $90,000 could trigger a sustained long-term uptrend for Bitcoin. Support Levels: $82,000 ‚Äì If Bitcoin fails to break $84,400, sellers may drag the price back to this support level, where buyers will attempt to defend it. $77,000 ‚Äì If $82,000 fails, BTC could drop further to $77,000, a crucial level that, if breached, may signal a market shift in favor of the bears. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 What‚Äôs Next for Bitcoin (BTC)? If bulls maintain strong momentum and break past this barrier, a rally toward $87,000 and potentially $90,000 could unfold. title: Why a Researcher Called XRP a ‚ÄúBiggest Scam‚Äù and Here‚Äôs How Ripple CTO Defended It?
body: After a constant downtrend for years, XRP gained bullish momentum in late 2024 and early 2025. However, since then, the Ripple token has been in turmoil. With that, many experts have been questioning the hype around this altcoin as its price performance and other metrics are questionable. One researcher even called it the biggest financial scam due to its low trading volume, but Ripple CTO bets differently. What‚Äôs happening? Let‚Äôs discuss. Researcher Claims XRP is the Biggest Scam Aylo, an alpha please researcher, has questioned the hype around the Ripple token , claiming that this is the biggest scam. In a recent X post, Aylo pointed out the XRPL‚Äôs decentralized exchange volume, arguing that it has only $44,000 in volume despite its high demand. With a snapshot from the DeFiLlama, he questions why such a top crypto with a high market capitalization has such a low volume. His remarks about the ‚Äòbiggest scam‚Äô on crypto, which was announced to be part of the U.S. Strategic Crypto Reserve , triggered discussion among the community. However, things got shorted as Ripple CTO David Schwartz came in support of the altcoin, along with a few other analysts presenting a different picture. Ripple CTO Discards Researcher‚Äôs XRP Allegation As the allegation led to a major discussion among the community, Ripple‚Äôs CTO corrected the researcher. With a comment on Aylo‚Äôs post, he clarified that the mentioned data represented only the Automated Market Makers (AMMs) on the XRPL. Notably, the AMMs account for just a minor portion of any network usage; Aylo‚Äôs allegation ended. David Schwartz also clarified that the suggested volume does not reflect the potential and utility of the Ripple token. I can‚Äôt find the exact page you‚Äôre looking at, but I bet that‚Äôs just looking at AMMs on XRPL, a miniscule fraction of what people use XRP for. Additionally, Vet, a dUNL validator, supports the Ripple CTO‚Äôs claims by presenting the correct volume figures. According to Vet‚Äôs stats, the actual 24-hour decentralized exchange volume on the XRPL is nearly $9M, which is not what the researcher claimed. More importantly, he called it the right opportunity for the market participants to leverage XRPL‚Äôs growth in the DeFi ecosystem. He claimed that a low DEX volume is the opportunity due to minimal participation. How is XRP Performing Today, and What‚Äôs Next? Despite the researcher‚Äôs scam allegation on the Ripple token, global investors still see it as a potential opportunity due to better updates from the SEC vs Ripple case, Donald Trump‚Äôs crypto reserve formation, and probable ETF launch this year. XRP currently trades at $2.40 with a market capitalization of $139.54B, making it the fourth biggest crypto after Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Tether. At present, its performance is significantly down amid the broader market correction. However, significant rallies with a shift in market sentiments are expected. The post Why a Researcher Called XRP a ‚ÄúBiggest Scam‚Äù and Here‚Äôs How Ripple CTO Defended It? appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Crypto debanking is not over until Jan 2026: Caitlin Long
body: Update March 22, 2025, 10:08 a.m. UTC: This article has been updated to include an embed of the Chainreaction episode. The cryptocurrency industry may still be facing debanking-related issues in the United States, despite the recent wave of positive legislation, according to crypto regulatory experts and industry leaders. The collapse of crypto-friendly banks in early 2023 sparked the first allegations of Operation Chokepoint 2.0 . Critics, including venture capitalist Nic Carter, described it as a government effort to pressure banks into cutting ties with cryptocurrency firms. Despite numerous crypto-positive decisions from US President Donald Trump, including the March 7 order to use Bitcoin ( BTC ) seized in government criminal cases to establish a national reserve , the industry may still be facing banking issues. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs premature to say that debanking is over,‚Äù according to Caitlin Long, founder and CEO of Custodia Bank. Long said during Cointelegraph‚Äôs Chainreaction daily X show on March 21: ‚ÄúThere are two crypto-friendly banks under examination by the Fed right now and an army of examiners was sent into these banks, including the examiners from Washington, a literal army just smothering the banks.‚Äù The Crypto Debanking Crisis: #CHAINREACTION https://t.co/nD4qkkzKnB ‚Äî Cointelegraph (@Cointelegraph) March 21, 2025 ‚ÄúThe Fed is the outlier and the Fed is still controlled by democrats,‚Äù explained Long, adding: ‚ÄúTrump won‚Äôt have the ability to appoint a new Fed governor until January. So therefore you can see the breadcrumbs leading up to a potentially big fight. Because if the OCC and FDIC overturn their anti-crypto guidance but the Fed does not, where does that leave us?‚Äù Long‚Äôs Custodia Bank was repeatedly targeted by the US debanking efforts, which cost the firm months of work and ‚Äúa couple of million dollars,‚Äù she explained. Industry outrage over alleged debanking reached a crescendo when a June 2024 lawsuit spearheaded by ‚Äã‚ÄãCoinbase resulted in the release of letters showing US banking regulators asked certain financial institutions to ‚Äúpause‚Äù crypto banking activities. Related: FDIC chair, ‚Äòarchitect of Operation Chokepoint 2.0‚Äô Martin Gruenberg to resign Jan. 19 Crypto debanking is the biggest operational problem in EU: blockchain regulations adviser Cryptocurrency debanking is also among the biggest challenges for European cryptocurrency firms, according to Anastasija Plotnikova, co-founder and CEO of blockchain regulatory firm Fideum. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre living in 2025 and debanking is still one of the main operational issues for both small and large crypto firms,‚Äù said Plotnikova, adding: ‚ÄúCrypto debanking is also a problem here in the EU. I had my accounts closed in 2017, 2018, 2019, 2021, and 2022, but 2024 was a good year. Operationally these problems exist for both users and crypto firms operating.‚Äù Related: Paolo Ardoino: Competitors and politicians intend to ‚Äòkill Tether‚Äô The comments come two weeks after the US Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) eased its stance on how banks can engage with crypto just hours after US President Donald Trump vowed to end the prolonged crackdown restricting crypto firms‚Äô access to banking services. Trump‚Äôs remarks were made during the White House Crypto Summit , where he told industry leaders he was ‚Äúending Operation Chokepoint 2.0.‚Äù Source: Elon Musk At least 30 tech and crypto founders were ‚Äúsecretly debanked‚Äù in the US during Operation Chokepoint 2.0, Cointelegraph reported in November 2024. Magazine: SEC‚Äôs U-turn on crypto leaves key questions unanswered

title: Pi Network‚Äôs PI Finally Rebounds, Bitcoin (BTC) Calm at $84K (Weekend Watch)
body: Bitcoin‚Äôs price consolidation around the $84,000 level continues as the asset has failed to breakout in either direction over the past week or so, despite a few attempts. Most altcoins sit quietly today, with little to no gains. PI has popped up by 9% after a recent landslide, while HYPE has surged by double digits. BTC Calm at $84K Last weekend went relatively quietly as BTC was stuck around the same level as now. The only exception came on Sunday evening after a whale opened a large short position, and BTC went up and down by about a grand. The beginning of the business week was also quieter, aside from a price slump toward $81,000 on Tuesday. However, BTC bounced off and jumped to $83,000 ahead of the second FOMC meeting for the year. Once that concluded on Wednesday and the Fed refused to change the key interest rates, BTC experienced some more volatility around $83,000 and $85,000. It went on the offensive later and spiked above $87,000 during the early morning Asian trading session. However, that was short-lived, and the asset slumped to $83,000 a day later. It has returned to $84,000 since then as it prepares for another calm weekend. Its market cap has risen to $1.670 trillion on CG, while its dominance over the alts has declined to 58.3%. BTCUSD. Source: TradingView PI Rebounds Pi Network‚Äôs native token is among the poorest performers on a weekly scale, having dumped by over 30%. However, it finally saw some relief in the past 24 hours, as its price has returned to $1 after an 8-9% surge. HYPE is the other notable gainer since yesterday, having jumped by 14-5%. It now trades above $16. In contrast, XRP, BNB, ADA, LEO, TON, and XLM are slightly in the red, while ETH, SOL, DOGE, and TRX have marked minor gains. The total crypto market cap failed to overcome the $2.9 trillion mark and now sits about $30 billion below it on CG. Cryptocurrency Market Overview. Source: QuantifyCrypto The post Pi Network‚Äôs PI Finally Rebounds, Bitcoin (BTC) Calm at $84K (Weekend Watch) appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs Twitter/X to retire final chunk of buyout debt held by Wall Street
body: Elon Musk‚Äôs social media platform X (formerly Twitter) is planning to repurchase the final $1.2 billion chunk of high-risk debt left over from the $44 billion Twitter buyout in 2022. This piece is known as second-lien debt, and it‚Äôs been sitting like dead weight on the books of seven major banks, led by Morgan Stanley, for almost three years. This last batch is the riskiest of the lot and has been the hardest to get rid of. The buyback might be funded using proceeds from a recent equity raise, according to a report from Bloomberg. They also said nothing‚Äôs locked in yet. The move, if finalized, would let banks finally dump the worst part of the $13 billion loan package that backed Elon‚Äôs takeover. Most of the other debt tied to the deal was already sold off earlier this year. The second-lien piece was the one nobody wanted. Banks unload risky leftovers as X pushes ahead Back when the buyout happened, banks expected to flip the loans quickly. Instead, they hit a wall. The value of X sank fast, and there were no buyers. The banks got stuck holding paper that nobody wanted and had to cut valuations by nearly half. But now the mood has shifted. One reason: Elon‚Äôs tight connection with President Donald Trump. That new proximity to the White House is changing how investors look at X‚Äôs debt. As one source put it, ‚ÄúIt took one election and a billionaire bromance to flip the script.‚Äù Morgan Stanley is now leading the charge to pitch a new $3 billion offering of X debt. They‚Äôre telling investors that X is stabilizing. Buyers who‚Äôve seen X‚Äôs financials say the numbers look better. X posted $400 million in Ebitda on $710 million revenue in Q4 2024. That‚Äôs higher than the two previous quarters. Morgan Stanley says X is on track for about $1.2 billion in adjusted Ebitda this year. Those improvements are making it easier for banks to sell what‚Äôs left. Loans that were once worth 60 cents on the dollar are now being offered at 95 cents or more, according to Bloomberg. Still, not everything looks pretty. X‚Äôs revenue is down nearly 50% since the original buyout. But major cost cuts by Elon have kept the business running. X‚Äôs earnings are flat compared to 2022, but those numbers are padded with a bunch of adjustments to make things look better. One investor said, ‚ÄúIf they thought they had lost 40% of their principal and now get out at something close to break even, that‚Äôs a nice turnaround.‚Äù Investors dig into X‚Äôs shady financials Some investors are raising red flags about how X reports money coming in from ‚Äúrelated parties‚Äù that aren‚Äôt part of the main platform. Restructuring costs are also being removed from the numbers. That includes layoffs ‚Äî a huge chunk of the workforce got axed after Elon took over. The company now has just $400 million in cash. That‚Äôs a steep drop from the $1.4 billion it had in 2022. Even with all that, the interest in X debt keeps growing. The recent $1 billion sale that closed at 90‚Äì95 cents per dollar sparked a flood of inquiries. It‚Äôs not just the business. It‚Äôs the Musk factor. One source said, ‚ÄúThere seems to be no shortage of investors wanting a chance to own a piece of X, and therefore the Musk empire.‚Äù The banks that backed the deal, despite the headaches, have made real money. Bloomberg says they earned about $3 billion in interest since 2022. That‚Äôs more than enough to wipe out any paper losses. Still, the longer they hold the debt, the more it gums up their balance sheets. That‚Äôs why they want out now, while the market is hot. Elon‚Äôs AI play sweetens the deal for buyers A big reason for renewed interest is X‚Äôs $6 billion stake in xAI, Elon‚Äôs artificial intelligence venture. Morgan Stanley is using that as a carrot in its sales pitch. If X goes south, buyers might have a claim on xAI. Investors like the optional upside. The current $3 billion offering matures in 2029 and pays 6.5% above the Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR). That adds up to a fat 12% yield. High return, high risk. X still doesn‚Äôt have a credit rating. Its leverage ratio is around 10 times earnings. That scares off some buyers, but the yield is pulling others in. Banks know this round won‚Äôt be the end. They‚Äôve still got other unsecured chunks on their books. Those are way riskier and could be nearly impossible to sell close to face value. But this round ‚Äî the one backed by xAI and improved numbers ‚Äî is the safest part left. This whole Twitter-turned-X saga is unlike anything Wall Street normally deals with. The fact that it might end with profits for the banks is wild. Robert Willens, a tax expert, said, ‚ÄúThey have certainly recovered more than 100 cents on the dollar.‚Äù Still, a lot of this is based on hype. Nobody knows how stable X really is. The platform‚Äôs revenue is still way down. Layoffs gutted the team. The cash pile is shrinking. But as long as the numbers can be adjusted just right, and as long as Elon keeps that White House connection, there‚Äôs a crowd ready to take the risk. And Wall Street? They‚Äôre finally seeing a way out of the mess. Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? Learn how DeFi can help you build steady passive income. Register Now

title: Cosmos price prediction 2025-2031: Will ATOM recover ATH?
body: Key takeaways : Cosmos‚Äôs price is predicted to reach a maximum value of $6.80 in 2025. In 2028, the coin could be worth between $18.49 and $21.97, with an average price of $19.01. By 2031, Cosmos (ATOM) might touch $67.56. Cosmos (ATOM) is a blockchain ecosystem that facilitates interoperability among independent blockchains. Co-founded by Jae Kwon and Ethan Buchman in 2014, Cosmos aims to create a decentralized network of blockchains that can communicate and transact seamlessly. Its main components include the Cosmos Hub, which serves as the central chain, and multiple ‚Äúzones‚Äù that operate under their own rules while connecting to the Hub. The platform uses the Tendermint consensus algorithm and Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol to enable fast low-cost transactions. Fees average around $0.01, and confirmation times are approximately seven seconds. Cosmos employs a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) mechanism, allowing users to stake their ATOM tokens for network security and transaction validation. Since its ICO in 2017, Cosmos has raised significant funding and established a growing ecosystem, including notable projects like Terra and Binance. With over 286 million ATOM tokens in circulation and a market cap exceeding $7.7 billion, Cosmos is positioned as a key player in the evolving landscape of blockchain technology, often referred to as the ‚ÄúInternet of Blockchains‚Äù for its ambitious goal of connecting diverse blockchain networks. Cosmos historic price sentiment Cosmos price history Cosmos, created by Ethan Buchman and Jae Kwon, launched its Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in 2017, with the network officially going live two years later in 2019. During the bullish market cycle of 2021, Cosmos saw its price peak at over $44, driven by significant investor interest and market optimism. However, following this surge, on 3rd April 2022, the price of Cosmos (ATOM) sharply declined to $6.39. Since then, Cosmos entered a prolonged phase of consolidation, trading within a range between $6.39 and $16 as market dynamics fluctuated. In early 2024, particularly around 8th March, Cosmos encountered significant resistance at the $13 level, struggling to gain momentum above this point. This resistance reflected broader market sentiment and potential selling pressure. By July 2024, ATOM‚Äôs price was trading in a narrower range, between $5 and $6, indicating a lack of upward momentum. By August 2024, the price had further dipped to $4.02, suggesting increasing bearish pressure. This recent decline highlights ongoing challenges for Cosmos in maintaining its price stability and suggests potential further downside as market bears dominate, putting pressure on potential buyers to defend against a continued downward trend. On September 2024, the Cosmos price ranged between $4 to $5, and on October 06, the price traded at $4.5837 with a trading volume of $48.48M. On November 5, ATOM was trading at $4.10. By December 5, ATOM‚Äôs price surged significantly, trading at $10. Cosmos ATOM surged to $9 at the start of December 2024, but it declined to $9.6 and closed the year at $6.3. In January 2025, Cosmos peaked at $7.77, and in February, it‚Äôs trading between $4.54 and $4.86. ATOM value decreased further in March as it dipped to the $4.0 to $4.2 range.

title: Alarming $18.6M Ethereum ETF Outflows: Spot ETH Funds See Concerning 13-Day Streak
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The U.S. spot Ethereum ETF market is experiencing some turbulence. Recent data reveals a notable trend that‚Äôs got investors and analysts alike scratching their heads. For thirteen consecutive trading days, we‚Äôve witnessed net outflows from these highly anticipated investment vehicles. Let‚Äôs dive into the details and explore what this could mean for the future of Spot Ethereum ETF s and the broader crypto landscape. What‚Äôs Happening with Ethereum ETF Outflows? On March 21st, U.S. spot Ethereum ETF s collectively saw a net outflow of $18.6 million. This marks the 13th day in a row where more money has been pulled out of these ETFs than invested. This consistent outflow raises questions about investor sentiment and the short-term trajectory of these investment products. While daily fluctuations are normal in the volatile crypto market, a persistent trend like this warrants closer examination. Let‚Äôs break down the key players and their contributions to this outflow: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA: Leading the pack in outflows was BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Ethereum Trust (ETHA), experiencing a net outflow of $11.9 million. As one of the largest asset managers globally, BlackRock‚Äôs ETF movements are closely watched, and this outflow is particularly noteworthy. Grayscale‚Äôs ETH: Grayscale‚Äôs Ethereum Trust (ETH) followed closely with a net outflow of $6.7 million. Grayscale, a pioneer in crypto investment products, has been navigating the transition of its existing trust into a spot ETF, and these outflows may reflect investor adjustments during this period. Other ETFs: The remaining spot Ethereum ETFs reported minimal net activity on March 21st, indicating that the outflows were primarily concentrated in BlackRock‚Äôs and Grayscale‚Äôs funds. ETF Provider ETF Ticker Net Outflow (USD) BlackRock ETHA $11.9 Million Grayscale ETH $6.7 Million Other ETFs ‚Äì Minimal/Neutral Total Net Outflow $18.6 Million Why are we seeing these outflows from Spot Ethereum ETFs? Several factors could be contributing to the recent Crypto ETF outflow trend. Understanding these potential drivers is crucial for investors trying to navigate the current market. Let‚Äôs explore some possibilities: Profit Taking: After the initial hype and inflows following the launch of spot Ethereum ETFs, some investors may be taking profits. The crypto market has seen significant gains recently, and ETF holders might be rebalancing their portfolios or securing returns. Market Volatility: The cryptocurrency market is known for its volatility. Periods of uncertainty or price corrections can trigger investors to reduce risk and move assets out of ETFs, especially those who are more risk-averse or trading on shorter timeframes. Macroeconomic Factors: Broader economic conditions, such as interest rate hikes or inflation concerns, can influence investor sentiment across all asset classes, including cryptocurrencies and related ETFs. Uncertainty in the global economy can lead to a general risk-off approach. Alternative Investment Opportunities: The crypto space is constantly evolving. New investment opportunities might be emerging that are drawing capital away from existing ETH ETF products. Investors may be shifting funds to DeFi projects, new token launches, or other areas within the digital asset ecosystem. Grayscale ETF Restructuring: As Grayscale converts its existing Ethereum Trust into a spot ETF, some investors who initially held shares in the trust might be re-evaluating their positions or seeking alternative ETF options. This transition period can sometimes lead to temporary outflows. Are Ethereum ETF Outflows a cause for concern? While 13 consecutive days of net outflows might sound alarming, it‚Äôs important to maintain perspective. Here‚Äôs a balanced view to consider: Early Stages: Spot Ethereum ETF s are still relatively new investment products. Market dynamics and investor behavior are likely to be more volatile in the initial phases as the market matures and finds its equilibrium. Broader Market Context: It‚Äôs essential to analyze these outflows in the context of the overall cryptocurrency market. Are we seeing outflows across the board, or is this specific to Ethereum ETFs? Examining broader market trends provides a more comprehensive picture. Long-Term Perspective: Investing in ETFs, particularly in emerging asset classes like crypto, is often a long-term strategy. Short-term fluctuations and outflows are not necessarily indicative of the long-term viability or success of these products. Focus on the underlying fundamentals and adoption of Ethereum and the broader crypto ecosystem. Outflow Volume: While the streak is notable, the daily outflow amounts are relatively small compared to the overall assets under management in the spot Crypto ETF market. It‚Äôs important to consider the magnitude of the outflows in relation to the total market size. What does this mean for the future of Ethereum ETFs? The recent Ethereum ETF Outflows present a mixed bag of signals. While the consecutive days of outflows are noteworthy, they don‚Äôt necessarily signal a long-term downturn for these investment products. Here‚Äôs what we can infer and consider moving forward: Market Correction or Consolidation: The outflows could simply be a sign of a healthy market correction or consolidation after a period of rapid growth and initial enthusiasm. This is a natural part of market cycles and not necessarily a negative indicator. Investor Sentiment Shift: It‚Äôs crucial to monitor if this outflow trend persists. A prolonged period of outflows could indicate a shift in investor sentiment towards Ethereum ETFs, potentially driven by factors mentioned earlier like macroeconomic conditions or alternative investment opportunities. Opportunity for Strategic Entry: For long-term investors who believe in the future of Ethereum and crypto, these outflows and potential price dips could present strategic entry points. ‚ÄúBuy the dip‚Äù is a common mantra in crypto investing, and periods of market correction can offer opportunities to accumulate assets at potentially lower prices. Importance of Diversification: The recent outflows underscore the importance of diversification in investment portfolios. Relying solely on one asset class or investment product can expose investors to concentrated risk. Diversifying across different asset classes and within the crypto space itself can help mitigate volatility and manage risk. Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors So, what should crypto investors take away from these ETH ETF outflow trends? Stay Informed: Keep a close watch on ETF flow data and broader market indicators. Utilize resources like Farside Investors and other reputable data providers to stay updated on market movements. Do Your Research: Understand the underlying factors driving market trends. Don‚Äôt react impulsively to short-term fluctuations. Conduct thorough research on the assets you invest in and the macroeconomic environment. Consider Long-Term Goals: Align your investment strategy with your long-term financial goals. Are you a long-term holder or a short-term trader? Your investment horizon should guide your decisions during periods of market volatility. Manage Risk: Implement robust risk management strategies. Diversification, position sizing, and stop-loss orders are essential tools for managing risk in the volatile crypto market. Seek Professional Advice: If you‚Äôre unsure how to navigate these market dynamics, consider seeking advice from a qualified financial advisor who understands the cryptocurrency market. Conclusion: Navigating the Ethereum ETF Landscape The $18.6 million net outflow from U.S. spot Ethereum ETF s on March 21st, extending a 13-day outflow streak, is a development worth noting. While it might raise eyebrows, it‚Äôs crucial to analyze this within the broader context of the nascent Spot Ethereum ETF market and the inherent volatility of the cryptocurrency space. These outflows could be driven by various factors, from profit-taking and market corrections to macroeconomic influences and evolving investment preferences. For investors, the key takeaway is to stay informed, maintain a long-term perspective, and manage risk effectively. The Ethereum ETF market is still in its early innings, and its long-term trajectory will depend on a multitude of factors, including continued adoption of Ethereum, regulatory developments, and overall market sentiment. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Dogecoin Breaks Under Ascending Triangle: 16% Crash Incoming?
body: An analyst has pointed out how Dogecoin could end up seeing an extended drawdown, based on this Ascending Triangle pattern forming in its hourly price. Dogecoin Has Lost The Support Of An Ascending Triangle Recently In a new post on X, analyst Ali Martinez has talked about an Ascending Triangle pattern for Dogecoin. The ‚ÄúAscending Triangle‚Äù refers to a technical analysis (TA) formation that appears when the price of an asset consolidates inside a triangular region. The ‚ÄòAscending‚Äô in the pattern‚Äôs name comes from the fact that this consolidation happens towards a net upside. There are two trendlines in this pattern: an upper level that‚Äôs parallel to the time-axis, tracing successive highs, and a lower one that has a positive slope, connecting successive higher lows. Related Reading: This Bitcoin Correction Is Different From March 2024‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Why Just like with any other consolidation pattern in TA, the upper level of the triangle is likely to be a source of resistance in the near future, while the lower one that of support. A break out of either of these boundaries can signal a continuation of trend in that direction. The Ascending Triangle isn‚Äôt the only type of triangular pattern in TA, two other popular varieties include the Descending Triangle and Symmetrical Triangle. The former of these is just the opposite of the Ascending Triangle: it forms when the price consolidates to the downside instead. The latter, the Symmetrical Triangle, is a sort of middle-ground between the Ascending and Descending versions, with both of its trendlines having an equal and opposite slope. That is, when the asset is inside this pattern, it converges at a mid-point. Recently, Dogecoin‚Äôs 1-hour price looked like it was following an Ascending Triangle. Here is the chart shared by Martinez, that shows this pattern for the memecoin: As is visible in the above graph, the hourly Dogecoin price recently made a retest of the lower line of this Ascending Triangle, but it would appear the coin has been unsuccessful in finding support at it, as it has slipped right through. Related Reading: XRP Jumps 7% After Surge In Network Activity & Whale Buying From the graph, it‚Äôs apparent that the memecoin wasn‚Äôt far from the apex of the triangle when this break came. Consolidation gets narrower as an asset reaches the end of the pattern, so breakouts start to become more likely. As mentioned before, a breakout can mean a potential continuation of trend in the direction of the break. So, in this case, DOGE has just witnessed a bearish signal. Often, the length of a move emerging out of an Ascending Triangle breakout is of the same length as the height of the triangle itself. Based on this, the analyst notes a 16% price swing could occur for the coin as a result of pattern. DOGE Price Dogecoin has taken to flat movement in the past week as its price is still floating around the $0.16 mark. Featured image from Dall-E, charts from TradingView.com

Pendle historic price sentiment PENDLE price history In September 2020, the price of Pendle started at around $1.0849, and a gradual decline followed. Between January and June 2021, the price remained relatively stable, fluctuating around the $0.90 to $1.0 range. Between July and December 2021, Pendle continued to exhibit minor fluctuations, maintaining a range around the $1.0 mark but showing no significant upward or downward trend. There was little to no significant upward or downward movement during this period. In June 2023, the price remained stable, with slight declines observed but staying well below the $1.0 mark. In January 2025, Pendle is trading between $5.1 to $5.3 However, the closing price for Pendle in January was $3.1. title: JPool‚Äôs Pursuit of Best Solana Staking: Liquidity, Community, and 28% APY
body: The post JPool‚Äôs Pursuit of Best Solana Staking: Liquidity, Community, and 28% APY appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News When it comes to staking on Solana, a network known for fast transactions and modest fees, JPool has managed to stand out in this bustling ecosystem. Their key selling points are 1.16 million SOL in TVL, a yield of up to 28% APY and robust community engagement. After a notable rebrand and a polished website revamp, JPool is advancing what it describes as the ‚ÄúPeak of Staking Satisfaction.‚Äù Why Liquid Staking Matters Traditional staking can sometimes limit DeFi activities by locking up tokens. Liquidity remains one of the biggest advantages of JPool‚Äôs approach: with JSOL in hand, stakers can buy, sell, or deploy those tokens in other protocols at any time. This mobility resonates strongly in the fast-paced Solana environment. Participants earn passive income and can move quickly when new DeFi integrations or trading opportunities arise. ‚ÄúCrypto investors today prize flexibility,‚Äù says JPool CEO and Co-Founder Sonny Wolfson . ‚ÄúThey still want to earn from staking but also remain nimble enough to respond to fast-paced shifts in the market. Liquid staking accomplishes that, and we recognized this need from the start.‚Äù The appeal of JPool‚Äôs model is evident in its growing TVL. Meanwhile, JPool‚Äôs High-Yield Staking delivers up to 28% annual returns boosted by MEV profits. Various Solana community projects have begun to integrate JSOL, which is adding to the token‚Äôs momentum. For example, DeFi platforms offering lending or advanced yield strategies can incorporate JSOL, broadening use cases and overall liquidity; something JPool‚Äôs team is actively encouraging through ongoing partnerships. A Fresh Image for a Growing Community JPool recently changed its look and feel, and these changes were more than just a new design. The updated interface offers a seamless way for users to stake their SOL tokens and immediately receive JSOL in return. From the outset, JPool‚Äôs developers focused on blending sophisticated functionality with a straightforward layout. Their goal is to make liquid staking available to a wider audience, including those new to Solana DeFi. The new platform guides users through each step‚Äîdepositing SOL, receiving JSOL, and tracking yields‚Äîwith as few clicks as possible. JPool‚Äôs team is convinced that streamlining the staking process allows participants to concentrate on spotting new market opportunities instead of wrestling with complex user interfaces. Holders Club and More Upcoming Features Another key part of JPool‚Äôs ecosystem is the Holders Club , an exclusive program that rewards loyal participants. Members earn JPoints by staking SOL, holding JSOL, or simply taking part in community activities. The more they accumulate these points, the higher they climb on the tier ladder: from Silver to Gold to Platinum, with better benefits at each tier. Holders Club members receive dedicated customer support, opportunities to participate in exclusive AMAs, and even have a say in JPool‚Äôs strategic decisions. Rather than throwing in a one-off loyalty bonus, the program encourages people to stay involved in the long term, building a strong, close-knit community. JPool frequently shares user feedback on their Twitter account to show how this direct input helps guide their plans. Looking ahead, the Holders Club will also see expansions. One concept under discussion involves more advanced governance rights, letting top-tier members propose‚Äîand vote on‚Äîkey decisions like fee adjustments or the integration of new Solana dApps. Seasonal challenges and special NFT drops have also been teased, aiming to keep the JPool community dynamic and engaged. The team behind JPool is constantly pushing forward, refusing to settle for past achievements. They‚Äôve been dropping hints about upcoming partnerships designed to deepen JSOL‚Äôs presence throughout the Solana ecosystem. While exact details remain under wraps, it‚Äôs clear that the team is going to collaborate with lending platforms and decentralized exchanges. With the integration of JSOL into additional DeFi services, JPool is going to give users expanded possibilities like margin trading, borrowing, and advanced auto-compounding yields. Security remains a top priority as well. JPool‚Äôs developers continuously conduct audits and test their smart contracts to ensure they‚Äôre strong and safe. The general approach is to maintain and enhance the trust that has already attracted such liquidity. JPool: A Smarter Approach to Solana Staking JPool has quickly become a big name in Solana‚Äôs DeFi space. Besides instant liquidity and user-focused design offerings, it is always on the lookout for new ways to boost community rewards and make liquid staking more profitable. Notably, the platform has introduced an advanced yield aggregator that currently boasts an impressive 28.53% APY, indicated on its dashboard. For many participants, JPool hits the sweet spot: it offers the benefits of staking without giving up the ability to seize new market opportunities. The DeFi ecosystem on Solana grows, and JPool‚Äôs progress serves as a case study of how to deliver a product that meets users‚Äô demands while keeping up with a market that‚Äôs always changing. For seasoned investors looking to optimize yield and newcomers intrigued by the flexibility of liquid staking, JPool clearly shows where the Solana staking space is headed. The project backs that vision with a solid set of tools, a strong community, and a roadmap pointing toward even greater integration in the months to come. Join JPool now and reach the peak of your staking satisfaction!
